meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules.
meanings.sent1: The precisians in the group insisted on following every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The teacher, a precisian, always checked every student's work for the smallest mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The precisians at the meeting argued for hours about the correct way to organize the event.
meanings.sent4: Her mother, a precisian when it came to baking, measured each ingredient with precision.
meanings.sent5: The precisians in the office meticulously reviewed every document before finalizing it.

meanings.definition: The group of people who adhere strictly to a particular set of beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The precisians of the community gathered regularly to discuss their shared beliefs.
meanings.sent2: As a member of the precisians, she followed the traditions passed down for generations.
meanings.sent3: The precisians of the book club only read classic literature and refused to try new genres.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the precisians were known for their unwavering commitment to vintage styles.
meanings.sent5: The precisians of the organization upheld the values that had guided them since its founding.
